text: One of the original Dark Lords of Nagash, the Dread King was a mighty Undead Liche of Nehekhara. A powerful warrior and practitioner of necromancy, he would become one of the most feared and mysterious beings to have ever existed.
I live to destroy once more!
Lured by promises of eternal unlife and power, Gunther Larenscheld has awoken the Dread King from his slumber and sworn loyalty to Nagash's cause.
Liches are mighty necromancers who achieved immortality through undeath. These brilliant generals lead his forces to victory after victory.
Brutally efficient warriors in life, these loyal followers of the Dread King are the spearhead of his army in death.
These Skeletons are able to hurl javelins true enough to blunt a charging foe.
These undead soldiers fight with spear and shield in phalanx formation.
No army could face them head on and think of victory.
Using secret knowledge of the Mortuary Cult, the servants of Nagash can create mighty undead by mummification. They are slow but resilient and mighty warriors who must not be underestimated.
Loyal in life and even more so in death, these mighty undead protected the tomb of the Dread King while he was waiting for his resurrection. Now they form the elite core of his infantry.
Loyal in life and even more so in death, these mighty undead protected the tomb of the Dread King while he was waiting for his resurrection. Now they form the elite core of his infantry.
Loyal in life and even more so in death, these mighty undead protected the tomb of the Dread King while he was waiting for his resurrection. Now they form the elite core of his infantry.
Loyal in life and even more so in death, these mighty undead protected the tomb of the Dread King while he was waiting for his resurrection. Now they form the elite core of his cavalry.
Loyal in life and even more so in death, these mighty undead protected the tomb of the Dread King while he was waiting for his resurrection. Now they form the elite core of his cavalry.
These powerful beasts plough through enemy lines with terrifying force.
Through foul necromancy, the skeletal remains of long-dead giants are brought back to a shambling unlife.
Ferocious beasts feared throughout the Old World have been revived in undeath.
Bolts of sharpened bone will bring down any beast.
These outlaws serve Gunther Larenscheld and follow him wherever he goes.
Powerful undead patrolling the labyrinths of the Dread King's pyramid.
These mighty Wights are the eternal guards of the Catacombs of Terror.
Nehekharan soldiers who joined the Dread King for the promise of land. Not that they would still need it....

The resurrected corpses of twelve long-dead Grail Knights of Bretonnia. Greater and more infamous than even the Blood Dragons of the time, they were among the mightiest Undead to have ever walked the Old World.
This ancient scholar was known throughout all of the Black Peninsula for his prophetic abilities. Now he uses them to lead the armies of the Dread King to victory.
These animated husks were the scholars and priests of an ancient civilization.
A Hellwraith is a terrifying prospect that has no corporeal form, making it extremely difficult to kill with conventional weaponry.
Only the most powerful wielders of necromancy can bring such a vile creature back to unlife.
They died to the last man fighting against impossible odds. Now they will do it again and again.
A famous unit whose soldiers were connected by a special band that binds them even in death.
Superb heavy horsemen who can smash through most opposition on their first charge.
There is wicked cunning in a machine that can fire so many bolts so quickly.
Once a great hero, now a mere puppet of a malicious spirit.
